metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8869 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: OCaml before 4.03.0 does not properly handle sign extensions, which allows remote attackers to conduct buffer overflow attacks or obtain sensitive information as demonstrated by a long string to the String.copy function. It was discovered that OCaml mishandled sign extensions. A remote attacker could use this vulnerability to steal sensitive information, cause a denial of service (crash), or possibly execute arbitrary code.

notes.Note: msalvatore> binaries built with ocamlopt will need to be rebuilt after a system upgrade

criterions.comment: ocaml: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
